ch.se.inf.ethz.jcd.batman.io

Class VDiskFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.se.inf.ethz.jcd.batman.io.VDiskFile

  • public class VDiskFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of a virtual disk entry (file or directory). This class provides everything needed to navigate inside a IVirtualDisk.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • VDiskFile

        public VDiskFile(java.lang.String pathname,
         IVirtualDisk disk)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a VDiskFile using the given path and a virtual disk. The given path does not have to exist yet on the disk.
        Parameters:
        pathname - the path to a file or directory
        disk - the disk to which the path belongs
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - TODO

      • VDiskFile

        public VDiskFile(java.lang.String parent,
         java.lang.String child,
         IVirtualDisk disk)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a VDiskFile using the given parent path, a child name and a virtual disk. The given path does not have to exist yet on the disk. This holds for the parent as for the child.
        Parameters:
        parent - the path to the parent directory
        child - the name of the child
        disk - the disk to which parent and child belong
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - TODO

      • VDiskFile

        public VDiskFile(VDiskFile parent,
         java.lang.String child)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a VDiskFile using the given parent and a child's name. The given parent and child do not have to exist yet.
        Parameters:
        parent - a VDiskFile representing the parent
        child - the name of the child
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - TODO
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if parent is null

    • Method Detail

      • isValidPath

        private boolean isValidPath(java.lang.String path)

      • getDiskEntry

        private IVirtualDiskEntry getDiskEntry(java.lang.String path)
        Returns a IVirtualDiskEntry for the given path.
        Parameters:
        path - path for which to return a IVirtualDiskEntry
        Returns:
        the corresponding IVirtualDiskEntry or null. Null is returned if the path is not valid or no disk entry exists yet

      • getChilds

        private java.util.Collection<IVirtualDiskEntry> getChilds()
                                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the children for the VDiskFile. A returned empty list may indicate that the directory has no children or that the VDiskFile does not represent a directory at all.
        Returns:
        a collection of children. Will never return a null value!
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - TODO
        See Also:
        isDirectory()

      • getDisk

        public final IVirtualDisk getDisk()
        Returns the disk associated with the VDiskFile.
        Returns:
        associated IVirtualDisk

      • getPath

        public java.lang.String getPath()
        Returns the path to the represented VDiskFile.
        Returns:
        path to the file or directory

      • exists

        public boolean exists()
        Returns an indicator indicating if the represented file exists on the virtual disk or not.
        Returns:
        true if the represented file or directory exists, otherwise false

      • isDirectory

        public boolean isDirectory()
        Returns an indicator if the VDiskFile is a directory.
        Returns:
        true if VDiskFile is directory, otherwise false

        Returns an indicator if the VDiskFile is a file.

        true if VDiskFile is a file, otherwise false

      • getParentFile

        public VDiskFile getParentFile()
        Returns a VDiskFile of the parent.
        Returns:
        VDiskFile representing the parent

      • list

        public java.lang.String[] list()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the names of all child elements. This does only work for directories. If it's not a directory or the directory contains no children this method will return an empty array.
        Returns:
        names of child elements
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        isDirectory()

      • listFiles

        public VDiskFile[] listFiles()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Returns an array of VDiskFile objects representing child elements. This does only work for directories. If it's not a directory or the directory contains no children this method will return an empty array.
        Returns:
        VDiskFile object for each child element
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • mkdir

        public boolean mkdir()
        Creates a directory for the path represented by the VDiskFile. This method will only create a directory if the parent already exists.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the directory was created
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • mkdirs

        public boolean mkdirs()
        Creates a directory for the path represented by the VDiskFile. This method will try to create any parent that does not yet exist along the way of the path.
        Returns:
        true if directory was created, otherwise false

      • renameTo

        public boolean renameTo(VDiskFile dest)
        Moves the VDiskFile to the given destination. This method can be used to rename and/or move a VDiskFile inside the same disk.
        Parameters:
        dest - the new destination of the VDiskFile
        Returns:
        true in case of success, otherwise false
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - in case of a fatal error resulting in an unstable state of the underlying disk

      • copyTo

        public boolean copyTo(VDiskFile targetFile)
        Copies the VDiskFile to the given targetFile. Note that only files can be copied, not directories or other virtual disk objects.
        Parameters:
        targetFile - target for the file
        Returns:
        true if copy was created successfully, otherwise false TODO: implement copyTo for directories

      • createNewFile

        public boolean createNewFile()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new, empty file of minimal size.
        Returns:
        true if file could be created in all other cases false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - TODO
        See Also:
        createNewFile(long)

      • createNewFile

        public boolean createNewFile(long size)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new, empty file of given size.
        Parameters:
        size - the size to reserve in advance. Must be greater than zero.
        Returns:
        true if file could be created in all other cases false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - TODO

      • setLastModified

        public boolean setLastModified(long time)
        Sets the last modified value.
        Parameters:
        time - the new time value
        Returns:
        true in case of success, otherwise false

      • lastModified

        public long lastModified()
        Returns the last modified value.
        Returns:
        the last modified value

      • getTotalSpace

        public long getTotalSpace()
        Returns the size of the object represented by VDiskFile. If the object does not yet exist on disk 0L is returned. In case of an exception a negative value is returned. Note: For a directory the returned value does not include the files inside it and their size. It will only return the size of the structure used to represent the directory.
        Returns:
        size in bytes of the represented object. If the object does not exist yet 0L is returned and in case of an error a negative value.

      • getDiskEntry

        public IVirtualDiskEntry getDiskEntry()
        Returns the IVirtualDiskEntry belonging to the represented object.
        Returns:
        the IVirtualDiskEntry representing the VDiskFile or null if object does not exist on disk

      • delete

        public boolean delete()
        Deletes the file or directory denoted by this object. If this object denotes a directory, then the directory must be empty in order to be deleted.
        Returns:
        true if the object was successfully deleted, false otherwise.
